perturbation.original_text:
Party B shall purchase sufficient insurance for the transportation vehicles. The coverage of third-party liability insurance shall not be lower than
RMB1 million. In addition to vehicle personnel insurance, Party B shall at least purchase injury insurance for two persons with coverage
not lower than RMB500,000 per person. Party B shall bear any consequence arising out of the non-compliance of insurance purchase, and
Party A shall have no liability.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B shall purchase insurance for the transportation vehicles. Party B shall bear any consequence arising out of the non-compliance of insurance purchase, and Party A shall have no liability.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific insurance coverage requirements, the contract becomes vague and potentially non-compliant with Chinese regulations that mandate minimum insurance levels for commercial transportation. This creates a legal loophole and exposes Party A to potential liabilities should Party B fail to secure adequate insurance. This is based on the assumption that regulations exist within China concerning minimum liability insurance for commercial vehicle operations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates the 'Road Traffic Safety Law of the People's Republic of China' and related regulations specifying minimum insurance requirements for commercial vehicles, assuming such laws exist and mandate specific coverage levels.

perturbation.original_text:
Party B shall ensure the vehicles are in good conditions, the compartments are properly sealed without leakage and the vehicles are
equipped with fire-fighting equipment. In the event of parcel damage resulting from leakage or fire, Party B shall indemnify at the
standard rate of RMB200 per parcel, and indemnify the actual price for high-end insured parcel (or indemnify by the value of the
parcel provided by arbitration department determined by Party A).
perturbation.changed_text: Party B shall ensure the vehicles are in good conditions and the compartments are properly sealed. In the event of parcel damage, Party B shall indemnify at a rate determined by Party A.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirement for fire-fighting equipment and removing the standard rate of RMB200 per parcel indemnity removes a key safety obligation and a clear standard for compensation in case of damage. This may violate regulations mandating safety equipment for vehicles transporting goods.  Also, failing to specify how damage will be indemnified exposes Party B to an arbitrary rate determined by Party A.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates 'Fire Protection Law of the People's Republic of China' or related transport regulations, assuming those laws dictate requirements for fire safety equipment and fair compensation.

perturbation.original_text:
Any dispute arising out of the execution of this Agreement, which cannot be negotiated and settled by both Parties, shall be subject to the
jurisdiction of the People’s Court where this Agreement is signed.
perturbation.changed_text: Any dispute arising out of the execution of this Agreement, which cannot be negotiated and settled by both Parties, shall be resolved at Party A's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the jurisdiction of the People's Court and stating the dispute will be resolved at Party A's discretion, violates the principle of fair dispute resolution, giving Party A total control in dispute resolution.  In many legal systems, including China, contracts that are deemed to severely limit one party's legal rights are subject to review.  Additionally, it is possible that China has laws in place requiring arbitration or other dispute resolution measures.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates the Contract Law of the People's Republic of China and the Civil Procedure Law of the People's Republic of China by undermining fair dispute resolution processes and procedural justice.
